20110129013024.000|20110129013028.000|CC1|I'M HIDESHI HARA IN TOKYO WITH  
20110129013028.000|20110129013028.000|CC1|THE LATEST AT THIS HOUR.        
20110129013028.000|20110129013030.000|CC1|DEMONSTRATORS ARE PROTESTING IN 
20110129013030.000|20110129013030.000|CC1|CITIES ACROSS EGYPT FRIDAY      
20110129013030.000|20110129013032.000|CC1|FOLLOWING NOON PRAYER.          
20110129013032.000|20110129013040.000|CC1|THEY ARE DEMANDING THE END OF   
20110129013040.000|20110129013041.000|CC1|HOSNI MUBARAK'S 30-YEAR RULE.   
20110129013041.000|20110129013046.000|CC1|IN GIZA, MOHAMED EL BARADEI,    
20110129013046.000|20110129013048.000|CC1|NOBEL PEACE PRIZE WINNER, JOINED
20110129013048.000|20110129013048.000|CC1|THE RALLY.                      
20110129013048.000|20110129013049.000|CC1|HE INTENDS TO RUN IN THE        
20110129013049.000|20110129013050.000|CC1|PRESIDENTIAL ELECTIONS THIS     
20110129013050.000|20110129013050.000|CC1|FALL.                           
20110129013050.000|20110129013051.000|CC1|THOUSANDS OF PROTESTERS SHOUTED 
20110129013051.000|20110129013055.000|CC1|DOWN WITH MUBARAK.              
20110129013055.000|20110129013056.000|CC1|EGYPTIAN POLICE USED WATER      
20110129013056.000|20110129013057.000|CC1|CANONS AND FIRED TEAR GAS ON THE
20110129013057.000|20110129013102.000|CC1|DEMONSTRATION.                  
20110129013102.000|20110129013103.000|CC1|EGYPTIAN AUTHORITIES DEPLOYED   
20110129013103.000|20110129013105.000|CC1|SECURITY FORCES NATIONWIDE.     
20110129013105.000|20110129013107.000|CC1|THEY HAVE ALSO SEALED OFF MAJOR 
20110129013107.000|20110129013108.000|CC1|ROADS LEADING TO GOVERNMENT AND 
20110129013108.000|20110129013110.000|CC1|GOVERNING PARTY BUILDINGS.      
20110129013110.000|20110129013112.000|CC1|ACCESS TO THE INTERNET AND      
20110129013112.000|20110129013113.000|CC1|MOBILE PHONE NETWORKS HAS BEEN  
20110129013113.000|20110129013120.000|CC1|DISRUPTED SINCE FRIDAY MORNING. 
20110129013120.000|20110129013122.000|CC1|THESE PRO DEMOCRAT CEASE        
20110129013122.000|20110129013123.000|CC1|DEMONSTRATIONS SPREAD INTO EGYPT
20110129013123.000|20110129013125.000|CC1|AFTER BEING SPARKED BY EVENTS IN
20110129013125.000|20110129013130.000|CC1|THE NORTH AFRICAN COUNTRY OF    
20110129013130.000|20110129013131.000|CC1|TUNISIA.                        
20110129013131.000|20110129013132.000|CC1|LAST MONTH, AN UNEMPLOYED       
20110129013132.000|20110129013132.000|CC1|TUNISIAN MAN WHO WAS SELLING    
20110129013132.000|20110129013133.000|CC1|VEGETABLES WITHOUT PERMISSION   
20110129013133.000|20110129013134.000|CC1|COMMITTED SUICIDE BY SETTING    
20110129013134.000|20110129013138.000|CC1|HIMSELF ON FIRE.                
20110129013138.000|20110129013139.000|CC1|HE WAS PROTESTING AGAINST A     
20110129013139.000|20110129013140.000|CC1|POLICE CRACKDOWN.               
20110129013140.000|20110129013142.000|CC1|THAT PROMPTED A LARGE NUMBER OF 
20110129013142.000|20110129013146.000|CC1|YOUNG PEOPLE TO TAKE TO THE     
20110129013146.000|20110129013146.000|CC1|STREETS AND DEMONSTRATE AGAINST 
20110129013146.000|20110129013147.000|CC1|THE GOVERNMENT.                 
20110129013147.000|20110129013148.000|CC1|PROTESTERS SHARED INFORMATION ON
20110129013148.000|20110129013149.000|CC1|THE INTERNET AND THEIR          
20110129013149.000|20110129013149.000|CC1|GATHERINGS TURNED VIOLENT IN    
20110129013149.000|20110129013155.000|CC1|MANY PARTS OF THE COUNTRY.      
20110129013155.000|20110129013155.000|CC1|CLASHES BETWEEN PROTESTERS AND  
20110129013155.000|20110129013156.000|CC1|SECURITY FORCES LED TO MANY     
20110129013156.000|20110129013159.000|CC1|DEATHS AND INJURIES.            
20110129013159.000|20110129013201.000|CC1|THE UNREST CAUSED THE PRESIDENT,
20110129013201.000|20110129013202.000|CC1|ZINE EL ABERDEEN BEN ALI TO FLEE
20110129013202.000|20110129013204.000|CC1|THE COUNTRY AFTER 23 YEARS OF   
20110129013204.000|20110129013207.000|CC1|HEAVY-HANDED RULE.              
20110129013207.000|20110129013208.000|CC1|AUTHORITARIAN LEADERS OF OTHER  
20110129013208.000|20110129013209.000|CC1|ARAB COUNTRIES IN THE REGION    
20110129013209.000|20110129013210.000|CC1|FEARED THE CHAOS WAS SPREAD, SO 
20110129013210.000|20110129013212.000|CC1|THEY QUICKLY ANNOUNCED EMERGENCY
20110129013212.000|20110129013213.000|CC1|ECONOMIC MEASURES TO DEAL WITH  
20110129013213.000|20110129013214.000|CC1|THE ANGER AT RISING PRICES AND  
20110129013214.000|20110129013220.000|CC1|UNEMPLOYMENT.                   
20110129013220.000|20110129013221.000|CC1|BUT PROMPTED BY EVENTS IN       
20110129013221.000|20110129013222.000|CC1|TUNISIA, A NUMBER OF PEOPLE IN  
20110129013222.000|20110129013223.000|CC1|EGYPT AND ALGERIA SET THEMSELVES
20110129013223.000|20110129013225.000|CC1|ON FIRE, DURING ANTI-GOVERNMENT 
20110129013225.000|20110129013228.000|CC1|DEMONSTRATIONS.                 
20110129013228.000|20110129013228.000|CC1|CROWDS ALSO TOOK TO THE STREETS 
20110129013228.000|20110129013234.000|CC1|IN YEMEN AND JORDAN TO PROTEST  
20110129013234.000|20110129013235.000|CC1|AGAINST THEIR GOVERNMENTS.      
20110129013235.000|20110129013236.000|CC1|AND ON TUESDAY, YOUNG PEOPLE IN 
20110129013236.000|20110129013237.000|CC1|EGYPT USED THE INTERNET TO      
20110129013237.000|20110129013237.000|CC1|ORGANIZE NATIONWIDE             
20110129013237.000|20110129013238.000|CC1|DEMONSTRATIONS.                 
20110129013238.000|20110129013238.000|CC1|OPPOSITION GROUPS JOINED IN AND 
20110129013238.000|20110129013239.000|CC1|PROTESTS ON AN UNPRECEDENTED    
20110129013239.000|20110129013246.000|CC1|SCALE BROKE OUT.                
20110129013246.000|20110129013247.000|CC1|IN A SQUARE IN DOWNTOWN CAIRO,  
20110129013247.000|20110129013248.000|CC1|MORE THAN 10,000 PEOPLE CALLED  
20110129013248.000|20110129013249.000|CC1|FOR THE RESIGNATION OF PRESIDENT
20110129013249.000|20110129013251.000|CC1|MUBARAK, WHO HAS BEEN IN POWER  
20110129013251.000|20110129013258.000|CC1|FOR NEARLY THREE DECADES.       
20110129013258.000|20110129013258.000|CC1|THEY FOUGHT WITH SECURITY       
20110129013258.000|20110129013259.000|CC1|FORCES, AND A NUMBER OF PEOPLE  
20110129013259.000|20110129013301.000|CC1|WERE EITHER KILLED OR INJURED.  
20110129013301.000|20110129013301.000|CC1|THE EGYPTIAN GOVERNMENT TRIED TO
20110129013301.000|20110129013302.000|CC1|STEM THE SPREAD OF THE UNREST BY
20110129013302.000|20110129013303.000|CC1|PUTTING RESTRICTIONS ON THE USE 
20110129013303.000|20110129013303.000|CC1|OF MOBILE PHONES AND THE

20110129013341.000|20110129013342.000|CC1|THE COUNTRY.

20110129013344.000|20110129013347.000|CC1|>> EVEN IF PRESIDENT MUBARAK    
20110129013347.000|20110129013348.000|CC1|GETS THROUGH THIS HARD TIME

20110129013351.000|20110129013351.000|CC1|PRESIDENTIAL ELECTION SCHEDULED 
20110129013351.000|20110129013400.000|CC1|FOR THIS FALL.                  
20110129013400.000|20110129013401.000|CC1|>> AND WHAT IMPACT WOULD THIS   
20110129013401.000|20110129013402.000|CC1|HAVE ON OTHER ARAB NATIONS?     
20110129013402.000|20110129013403.000|CC1|>> EGYPT HAS THE LARGEST        
20110129013403.000|20110129013403.000|CC1|POPULATION IN THE ARAB WORLD AND
20110129013403.000|20110129013404.000|CC1|HAS BEEN VERY INFLUENTIAL IN THE
20110129013404.000|20110129013404.000|CC1|REGION.                         
20110129013404.000|20110129013405.000|CC1|FOR EXAMPLE, IT PLAYS AN        
20110129013405.000|20110129013406.000|CC1|IMPORTANT ROLE IN MIDDLE EAST   
20110129013406.000|20110129013409.000|CC1|PEACE TALKS.                    
20110129013409.000|20110129013413.000|CC1|IN THE CASE OF TUNISIA, A       
20110129013413.000|20110129013416.000|CC1|SECULAR PROTEST INVOLVING A WIDE
20110129013416.000|20110129013417.000|CC1|DEMOGRAPHIC OF THE GENERAL      
20110129013417.000|20110129013417.000|CC1|PUBLIC WAS ABLE TO REMOVE THE   
20110129013417.000|20110129013418.000|CC1|PRESIDENT.                      
20110129013418.000|20110129013419.000|CC1|EXPERTS POINT OUT IT WAS A      
20110129013419.000|20110129013426.000|CC1|WESTERN-STYLE MOVEMENT, THE VERY
20110129013426.000|20110129013426.000|CC1|FIRST IN THE ARAB WORL          
20110129013426.000|20110129013430.000|CC1|THEY DESCRIBE IT LITERALLY AS A 
20110129013430.000|20110129013431.000|CC1|REVOLUTION.                     
20110129013431.000|20110129013432.000|CC1|IF THE SAME THING HAPPENS IN

20110129013433.000|20110129013437.000|CC1|OTHER ARAB NATIONS MIGHT BE

20110129013437.000|20110129013438.000|CC1|>> THANKS.                      
20110129013438.000|20110129013646.000|SEG|Type=Story
20110129013438.000|20110129013439.000|CC1|>>> PEOPLE IN SOUTHWESTERN JAPAN
20110129013439.000|20110129013440.000|CC1|ARE KEEPING A CLOSE EYE ON AN   
20110129013440.000|20110129013444.000|CC1|ACTIVE VOLCANO.                 
20110129013444.000|20110129013445.000|CC1|MT. SHINMOE ERUPTED AGAIN       
20110129013445.000|20110129013451.000|CC1|FRIDAY, SPEWING HUGE AMOUNTS OF 
20110129013451.000|20110129013452.000|CC1|SMOKE AND ASH.                  
20110129013452.000|20110129013452.000|CC1|THE LATEST ERUPTION SENT SMOKE  
20110129013452.000|20110129013453.000|CC1|RISING UP TO 1,000 METERS INTO  
20110129013453.000|20110129013455.000|CC1|THE SKY.                        
20110129013455.000|20110129013456.000|CC1|MT. SHINMOE IS PART OF THE      
20110129013456.000|20110129013458.000|CC1|KIRISHIMA MOUNTAIN RANGE WHICH  
20110129013458.000|20110129013458.000|CC1|STRADDLES KAGOSHIMA AND MIYAZAKI
20110129013458.000|20110129013503.000|CC1|PREFECTURES.                    
20110129013503.000|20110129013505.000|CC1|IT RUMBLED TO LIFE ON THURSDAY  
20110129013505.000|20110129013505.000|CC1|AFTER BEING DORMANT FOR 52      
20110129013505.000|20110129013506.000|CC1|YEARS.                          
20110129013506.000|20110129013509.000|CC1|A LOCAL WEATHER OBSERVATORY SAYS
20110129013509.000|20110129013510.000|CC1|WINDS OVER THE CRATER ARE       
20110129013510.000|20110129013512.000|CC1|SCATTERING ASH ACROSS           
20110129013512.000|20110129013513.000|CC1|A WIDE AREA FROM KIRISHIMA CITY 
20110129013513.000|20110129013516.000|CC1|SOUTH OF THE VOLCANO TO MIYAZAKI
20110129013516.000|20110129013517.000|CC1|CITY, ABOUT 15 KILOMETERS TO THE
20110129013517.000|20110129013517.000|CC1|EAST.                           
20110129013517.000|20110129013518.000|CC1|IT WARNS MASSIVE AMOUNTS OF ASH 
20110129013518.000|20110129013523.000|CC1|WILL LIKELY FALL ON THE         
20110129013523.000|20110129013524.000|CC1|SOUTHEASTERN SIDE OF THE        
20110129013524.000|20110129013524.000|CC1|MOUNTAIN AS THE WIND DIRECTION  
20110129013524.000|20110129013525.000|CC1|CHANGES.                        
20110129013525.000|20110129013526.000|CC1|VOLCANIC ASH IS SERIOUSLY       
20110129013526.000|20110129013531.000|CC1|AFFECTING DAILY LIFE IN VARIOUS 
20110129013531.000|20110129013532.000|CC1|PARTS OF THE REGION.            
20110129013532.000|20110129013533.000|CC1|IN MIYAZAKI CITY, FALLING ASH IS
20110129013533.000|20110129013534.000|CC1|GREATLY REDUCING VISIBILITY.    
20110129013534.000|20110129013535.000|CC1|MANY PEOPLE COULD BE SEEN       
20110129013535.000|20110129013548.000|CC1|CARRYING UMBRELLAS.             
20110129013548.000|20110129013549.000|CC1|THE CITY IS LOCATED SOUTHEAST OF
20110129013549.000|20110129013550.000|CC1|MOUNT SHIN-MOE, NOW THE HARVEST 
20110129013550.000|20110129013550.000|CC1|SEASON FOR CABBAGES.            
20110129013550.000|20110129013553.000|CC1|FARMERS WERE BUSY WASHING THEIR 
20110129013553.000|20110129013556.000|CC1|PRODUCE.                        
20110129013556.000|20110129013558.000|CC1|THEY FEAR THE ASH MAY HURT      
20110129013558.000|20110129013614.000|CC1|MARKET PRICES.                  
20110129013614.000|20110129013615.000|CC1|AT MIYAZAKI AIRPORT A DECISION  
20110129013615.000|20110129013618.000|CC1|WAS MADE TO CLOSE ALL THE       
20110129013618.000|20110129013619.000|CC1|RUNWAYS.                        
20110129013619.000|20110129013619.000|CC1|AIRLINES DECIDED TO CANCEL ALL  
20110129013619.000|20110129013621.000|CC1|FLIGHTS FOR THE REST OF THE DAY 
20110129013621.000|20110129013622.000|CC1|OUT OF FEAR THE ASH MIGHT BE    
20110129013622.000|20110129013624.000|CC1|SUCKED INTO AIRCRAFT ENGINES AND
20110129013624.000|20110129013628.000|CC1|CAUSE AN ACCIDENT.              
20110129013628.000|20110129013629.000|CC1|SCHOOLS WERE CLOSED DOWN IN     
20110129013629.000|20110129013630.000|CC1|SEVERAL CITIES.                 
20110129013630.000|20110129013633.000|CC1|THOSE THAT REMAINED OPEN HELD   
20110129013633.000|20110129013636.000|CC1|PHYSICAL EDUCATION CLASSES      
20110129013636.000|20110129013639.000|CC1|INSIDE THEIR GYMNASIUMS.        
20110129013639.000|20110129013640.000|CC1|TO PROTECT STUDENTS FROM        
20110129013640.000|20110129013640.000|CC1|BREATHING IN THE FINE ASH       
20110129013640.000|20110129013646.000|CC1|PARTICLES.                      
20110129013646.000|20110129013803.000|SEG|Type=Story
20110129013646.000|20110129013647.000|CC1|>>> SO WHAT TRIGGERED THE       
20110129013647.000|20110129013649.000|CC1|ERUPTION AND HOW LONG WILL THIS 
20110129013649.000|20110129013651.000|CC1|VOLCANIC ACTIVITY CONTINUE?     
20110129013651.000|20110129013652.000|CC1|THE UNIVERSITY OF TOKYO'S       
20110129013652.000|20110129013656.000|CC1|EARTHQUAKE RESEARCH INSTITUTE   
20110129013656.000|20110129013658.000|CC1|SAYS AFTER THE ERUPTION A LARGE 
20110129013658.000|20110129013659.000|CC1|LAVA DOME FORMED IN THE CRATER. 
20110129013659.000|20110129013703.000|CC1|THIS PHENOMENON OCCURS WHEN LAVA
20110129013703.000|20110129013704.000|CC1|EXTRUDES FROM A VOLCANIC EVENT. 
20110129013704.000|20110129013705.000|CC1|THEY ALSO FOUND TRACES OF MINOR 
20110129013705.000|20110129013715.000|CC1|PYROPLASTIC FLOW ON THE VOLCANO.
20110129013715.000|20110129013718.000|CC1|THE AUTHORITY HAS ESTIMATED THE 
20110129013718.000|20110129013720.000|CC1|VOLUME OF MAGMA BASED ON GPS    
20110129013720.000|20110129013722.000|CC1|DATA ESTIMATES SINCE MAY LAST   
20110129013722.000|20110129013727.000|CC1|YEAR ABOUT 1 MILLION CUBIC      
20110129013727.000|20110129013728.000|CC1|METERS OF MAGMA HAVE ACCUMULATED
20110129013728.000|20110129013729.000|CC1|ABOUT THREE KILOMETERS BELOW THE
20110129013729.000|20110129013729.000|CC1|CRATER.                         
20110129013729.000|20110129013730.000|CC1|THAT IS ENOUGH TO FILL 400      
20110129013730.000|20110129013733.000|CC1|OLYMPIC-SIZE SWIMMING POOLS.    
20110129013733.000|20110129013734.000|CC1|IT ALSO SAYS THAT 6 MILLION     
20110129013734.000|20110129013735.000|CC1|CUBIC METERS OF MAGMA HAD       
20110129013735.000|20110129013737.000|CC1|ACCUMULATED TEN KILOMETERS WEST 
20110129013737.000|20110129013738.000|CC1|NORTHWEST OF THE CRATER AT A    
20110129013738.000|20110129013742.000|CC1|DEPTH OF 6 KILOMETERS.          
20110129013742.000|20110129013743.000|CC1|THE AUTHORITY HAS SAID THE      
20110129013743.000|20110129013744.000|CC1|MOUNTAIN HAS SHRUNK IN SIZE     
20110129013744.000|20110129013744.000|CC1|SLIGHTLY SINCE WEDNESDAY        
20110129013744.000|20110129013745.000|CC1|PROBABLY DUE TO THE LARGE       
20110129013745.000|20110129013747.000|CC1|ERUPTION.                       
20110129013747.000|20110129013749.000|CC1|THEY WILL CONTINUE WATCHING TO  
20110129013749.000|20110129013751.000|CC1|SEE WHETHER THE GROUND WILL     
20110129013751.000|20110129013752.000|CC1|BEGIN SWELLING AGAIN.           
20110129013752.000|20110129013755.000|CC1|THE LOCAL OBSERVATORY WARNS     
20110129013755.000|20110129013757.000|CC1|LARGE ROCKS COULD FALL UP TO TWO
20110129013757.000|20110129013758.000|CC1|KILOMETERS AWAY FROM THE CRATER 
20110129013758.000|20110129013800.000|CC1|AND IS URGING PEOPLE NOT TO     
20110129013800.000|20110129013803.000|CC1|ENTER THE DANGER ZONE.          
20110129013803.000|20110129014302.000|SEG|Type=Story
20110129013803.000|20110129013804.000|CC1|>>> PRIME MINISTER KAN'S BACK IS
20110129013804.000|20110129013806.000|CC1|AGAINST THE WALL.               
20110129013806.000|20110129013807.000|CC1|HE'S TRYING TO GET THE COUNTRY'S
